content: a jaunty accessory designed to make the most of our aran-weight alpaca and silk blend and one that weighs practically nothing atop your head tilt this shallow beret at a rakish angle for adventuring and maximum fun make one to match your sherbet bandana 1 sample shown dimond laine big birdie in color beret sizes one size finished measurements to fit an average adult head 20-21 in circumference beret measures 18 circumference at ribbed edge yarn requirements *please note these are estimates the amount used will depend on yarn your personal gauge and any modifications you make * dimond laine big birdie 79% alpaca 21% silk 174 yards per 100 grams 1 skein or 105 yards / 96m of an aran-weight yarn needles *needles listed are suggested * gauge needle us 7 4 5mm 16 circular and double-point needles ribbing needle us 6 4mm 16 circular needle or one needle size smaller than gauge needle tools bor marker darning needle optional seven markers in a different color from bor marker gauge 17 sts and 22 rounds = 4 in stockinette stitch in the round blocked errata version 1 we ve clarified the language in the note about adding depth to your beret under the heading even rounds note here is where you can change the overall depth of your beret seven rounds will yield a piece of about 8 in total depth…our samples were knit per pattern with seven even rounds here and 8 of depth from cast-on through the decreases 1 https //www ravelry com/patterns/library/sherbet-bandana
